column4: hey i am trying to set up vnc4server onmy ubuntu 10.4 box and have folled all the instructions i can find to comment out lines in .vnc/xstartup and i keep getting a grey screen
At a minimum, you need to call gnome-session in the vnc startup script so that the desktop environment ships.  The empy gray screen is the default X11 window.
You cut-and-pasted from a not-Ubuntu tutorial.   You need to change this script to do it The Ubuntu Way.  Mostly, replace everything with `gnome-session` and see if you get any further.
do you have a tut i should follow
Did you try what I suggested?
yes and still get the same result
Look in /usr/share/doc for the sample configuration file.  Start from scratch.
Double check that you have the ubuntu-desktop meta package installed.  VNC needs everything that a regular desktop uses.
that didnt fix it maybe i need to reboot
No, if OpenOffice was the only thing missing, then you have another problem.
i just rebooted ill test it when it comes back up
If the sample configuration file doesn't work, then you should check your system for sanity.  Try VNC through System -> Preferences -> Remote Desktop.
right now the box is headless so i can only get to it via ssh
Doesn't matter.  Shell into the computer with `ssh -X` and run `vino-preferences`.
